image.altText: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: The US president has called for Iran's "unconditional surrender" and warned Tehran that US patience is "wearing thin". Follow live.

title.children: Trump calls for Iran's 'unconditional surrender' as residents flee capital

image.altText: Close up of Donald Trump talking in suit with red tie and trees in background

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei would be "an easy target", in a series of posts about the Iran-Israel conflict.

title.children: Within one hour, Donald Trump changed the tone on Iran

image.altText: A man carries a wounded girl after an explosion in downtown Tehran

image.altText: Optus

props.synopsis: Optus admits to engaging in unconscionable conduct and agrees to a $100 million penalty for selling customers phones and contracts they did not want or need.

title.children: Optus faces $100m penalty for unconscionable conduct

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's defence lawyer is continuing his closing address to the jury after eight weeks of evidence in the triple-murder trial. Follow live.

image.altText: A smiling woman sits with her laughing daughter on her lap.

props.synopsis: A Sydney mother is calling for change after being told her daughter with disability would have to wait five months for a scan her doctor said was urgent.

title.children: 5yo girl with growth in ear told to wait five months for scan

image.altText: A man in a royal blue suit, white shirt and light blue tie sits in a room with red carpet looking toward something out of frame

props.synopsis: General He Weidong, China's second-ranking military official and a co-vice-chairman of the powerful Central Military Commission, has not been seen in public since March.

title.children: Beijing's inner circle fractures as Xi's top military official disappears

image.altText: A worker wearing a hard hat with the CFMEU logo emblazoned across it.

props.synopsis: Former CFMEU officials lose a High Court challenge to changes to the Fair Work Act which forced the construction arm of the union into administration.

image.altText: A close up of Albanese with an Australian map behind him

image.altText: Santos's Darwin LNG plant is seen from overhead at dusk.

title.children: Has the Santos takeover handed the government a gift on energy security?

image.altText: large, orange mushroom cloud takes up the evening sky over a woman standing outside her house

props.synopsis: One of Indonesia's most active volcanoes has erupted, spewing hot ash and smoke plumes seen 150 kilometres away.

title.children: Hot ash, mushroom cloud erupts from one of Indonesia's most active volcanoes

image.altText: Next ATM in a closed tobacconist in Burpengary

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation finds that among investments raking in the dollars for the Australian-founded Macquarie Group is the nation's billion-dollar illegal tobacco trade.

image.altText: A man being led by multiple police officers into the back of a paddy wagon.

props.synopsis: The four males have been charged with multiple offences including aggravated sexual assault and sexual intercourse without consent, with two expected to appear in court on Wednesday.

title.children: Four teenagers charged over alleged gang rape of 17yo girl in Sydney

image.altText: A large fireball rises into the sky at night as people watch on from a nearby bridge

props.synopsis: Restrictions around sexually active gay and bisexual men donating blood and plasma are being loosened in a new world-leading move by Australian Red Cross Lifeblood.

title.children: Australian Red Cross loosens rules around LGBTQIA+ people donating plasma

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest customer for iron ore doesn't need as much steel anymore, but the Pilbara's biggest producers have no plans to slow down production.

title.children: Iron ore is Australia's most valuable export, but China's data suggests that's changing

image.altText: Kate Robinson

props.synopsis: Kate Robinson left her laptop on charge in her bedroom while running errands. An hour later, she returned to find her house and yoga studio engulfed in flames.

title.children: Home owner warns against charging laptops on beds after fire guts house

image.altText: A modular home is being craned onto site in the South West town of Boyanup.

props.synopsis: Business and community leaders outside Perth say the lack of developed land with the necessary power and water infrastructure will hurt the Cook government's push for modular housing.

image.altText: A graphic imge of a farmer looking at sheep.

props.synopsis: Mental health experts warn of the dangers of spreading misinformation after unverified figures of the number of Victorian farmers who have taken their own lives circulated on social media.

title.children: Warning for MPs over 'dangerous' mental health misinformation

image.altText: Rest stop fire

props.synopsis: Police have taken a man allegedly armed with a metal pole into custody after a fire at a Queensland rest stop where multiple people were camping.

title.children: Police arrest man after fire destroys six camper trailers at rest stop

image.altText: a group walk along a country road in Western Victoria bounded by dry paddocks

props.synopsis: A Yoorrook Justice Commissioner is set to reach Victorian parliament after walking 500 kilometres to mark the closure of Australiaâ€™s first formal Aboriginal truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: Thousands join walk as Australian-first truth-telling inquiry ends

image.altText: Several seals laying on a shelf of ice in Antarctica.

props.synopsis: Australia's ability to conduct strategic, in-depth, and long-term research in Antarctica is being compromised by "terminating" funding models for key programs, scientists warn.

title.children: Antarctic research jeopardised by 'terminating' funding, scientists say

image.altText: Three men wearing hi-vis and hard hats, one of them speaks at microphone

props.synopsis: The federal energy minister will announce changes to how benchmark power prices are set, aimed at cutting back how much energy retailers can hit consumers to cover costs like advertising, on Wednesday.

title.children: Federal government to change power price rules to push costs lower

image.altText: Jim Chalmers GDP figures

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers will throw open the door to a wider debate on potential tax changes at the government's economic reform summit in August as the treasurer hangs a lantern on Labor's "obligation to work out what comes next".

title.children: Treasurer opens door to tax debate at productivity roundtable

image.altText: Generic childcare picture

props.synopsis: Parents, educators and experts say the reforms are tokenistic, a band-aid fix, and ignore the deeper structural failures festering in the childcare system.

title.children: Until the childcare sector has meaningful reform, voiceless children will suffer hideous incidents

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a denim top holding a teddy

props.synopsis: Newborn baby Alby died after an obstructed labour. Despite an initial coroner's report ruling his death was not preventable, a fresh investigation has been launched.

title.children: Inquest for newborn baby boy who died in Queensland hospital

image.altText: A rock carving of an emu on red rocks

props.synopsis: After UNESCO expressed concern that the extension of Woodside's North West Shelf gas facility would cause nearby Murujuga rock art to be rejected from the World Heritage List, the environment minister will dispatch officials to lobby the agency to reconsider.

title.children: Government to protest UNESCO concerns for Murujuga rock art in Paris

image.altText: Pint being poured

props.synopsis: The ongoing US-China trade war sparks an opportunity for breweries like WA's Rocky Ridge and Shelter Brewing to make their first forays into the Asian giant.

title.children: Craft brewer says beer easier to sell in Beijing than Busselton
